name: austerely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is very simple or plain, without decoration or unnecessary details: Her dress was simple and austerely elegant. The book is austerely but beautifully illustrated.
in a way that has only the things that are absolutely necessary, especially because of severe limits on money or goods: He was brought up austerely in a small town with no toys, no sweets, and few friends.
in a severe and unfriendly way: "You have no choice," he said austerely. See
austere
More examplesFewer examplesThe river is an austerely beautiful 40-mile stretch of water.This is an austerely plotted but moving collection of stories.Dressed austerely - long black skirt, pulled-back hair, no earrings or makeup - she paces the narrow stage with nervous energy.They sat in an austerely furnished room under a bare lightbulb.She smiled a little, austerely.
